meanings: (몹시, 심하게) violently, severely, badly, harshly, wildly, blindly
(물체의 표면을 덮고 있는 얇은 조직) film (of), membrane

examples.korean: The daffodils are just beginning to come up. 발음듣기 수선화가 막 움이 트기 시작하고 있다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: The daffodils are just beginning to come up. 발음

examples.korean: a toddler’s first few halting steps 발음듣기 이제 막 걸음마를 배우는 아기의 멈칫거리는 첫 몇 발자국 Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: a toddler’s first few halting steps 발음

examples.korean: She peeked at the audience from behind the curtain. 발음듣기 그녀는 막 뒤에서 관객을 훔쳐보았다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: She peeked at the audience from behind the curtain. 발음

examples.korean: Months of hard work culminated in success. 발음듣기 여러 달 동안 했던 힘든 일이 성공적으로 막을 내렸다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: Months of hard work culminated in success. 발음

examples.korean: There was tremendous applause when the curtain came down. 발음듣기 막이 내리자 엄청난 박수가 터져 나왔다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: There was tremendous applause when the curtain came down. 발음
